formattedAddress: 261 Water St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 261 Water St, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Tucked-away locale serving steaks, chops & seafood dishes in white-tablecloth surrounds.

originalText.text: This was a good dinner option. Service was fantastic. Atmosphere was great. A little off the main streets but tables were dressed for fine dining. Had the filet, mashed potatoes and asparagus. One bread roll provided - was good - really felt like a Hawaiian sweet roll though. Butter was too cold to spread.  The steak was cooked correctly. The food was okay.  Steak was a steak - nothing special. Mashed potatoes tasted like ones I make at home. A bit pricey for the overall taste. Was there for business travel, would not go back as there are lots of other steakhouses to try.

text.text: This was a good dinner option. Service was fantastic. Atmosphere was great. A little off the main streets but tables were dressed for fine dining. Was there for business travel, would not go back as there are lots of other steakhouses to try.

originalText.text: It‚Äôs been close to a decade since I last visited this restaurant and it was exceptional back then. Really was shocked with the food this time around. I went on a Friday night for my reservation at 6:45pm. The Hostess was welcoming and so was the bartender. Their were a few guests sitting at the bar, I had a cocktail at the bar and had the hostess show me to my table. It was how I remembered from a decade ago after Hurricane Sandy, not crowded at all. So, I ordered the Lobster Bisque, which came out lukewarm, not a good start. For my main entree, I had the Sirloin Steak medium rare cooked perfectly temperature wise. The sides I ordered to accompany my Sirloin were the mashed potato, saut√© mushrooms and asparagus. From the taste of all of the food I ordered nothing really stood out, the food was extremely BLAND!  There were no seasoning on any of the food.  I loaded each item I ordered with salt and pepper just to give the food some flavor. Overall, my experience for dinner was okay.  But, who ever is the Chef needs to season food that cost a lot in NYC Steakhouses.

originalText.text: I always have oysters here they are the best across town. Very well cooked steak and lobster. Excellent and friendly service. You can‚Äôt fault it when you go here.

text.text: I always have oysters here they are the best across town. Very well cooked steak and lobster. Excellent and friendly service. You can‚Äôt fault it when you go here.

originalText.text:
Mark Joseph is a quintessential location for a higher end steakhouse experience- I came here during restaurant week and dined on their 59 dollar menu.

For my appetizer I had the lobster bisque as was recommended- it had small chunks of lobster with a nice deep lobster flavor, it's served with fresh black pepper.

For mains, I had the Sirloin Steak, it's served on hotplates so be careful. I asked for medium rare but some of the steak pieces remain on the hot plate, so cooking times and  doneness varied a bit, but was nevertheless very good.

The dessert was a mini brownie sundae, seemed pretty simple and nothing special.

Multiple servers came to prepare each course.

The dessert was a mini brownie sundae, seemed pretty simple and nothing special.

originalText.text: The bartender Mike is great. He is very friendly and helpful. Made many good recommendations for food. Also, great dirty martinis üôèüèª their fries are delicious and the steak sandwich which you can only order at the bar or lunch is fantastic. Also, I recommend the thick cut Canadian bacon. So good
